Legal_Issue: Whether the Board properly assessed if discrimination amounted to persecution and if adequate state protection existed
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed refugee status due to alleged persecution in Macedonia based on mixed marriage and related discrimination
Decision_Outcome: Board's decision was reasonable and justified; application for judicial review dismissed
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Boardâ€™s dismissal of refugee claims
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; Board's decision upheld
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution based on mixed marriage and discrimination in Macedonia
Legal_Standard: Persecution requires serious mistreatment affecting core human rights, assessed cumulatively
Assessment_Factor: Severity of discrimination, availability of state protection
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review conducted under reasonableness standard
Evidence_Used: Past incidents resolved by authorities in Macedonia
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to mixed marriage and discrimination
Evidence_Assessed: Incidents of discrimination and state response
Governing_Rule: Persecution requires serious mistreatment; state protection presumed unless proven otherwise
Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed; judicial review denied
Decisional_Body: Refugee Protection Division / Refugee Appeal Division
Harm_Assessment: Discrimination not severe enough to constitute persecution
Cause_Description: Alleged persecution in Macedonia due to mixed marriage and societal discrimination
Evidence_Handling: Board considered past incidents and state intervention as evidence of protection
Evidence_Assessment: Board found state protection available based on resolution of prior incidents
Decision_Rationale: Discrimination not rising to level of persecution; state protection deemed effective
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard in judicial review; persecution threshold under refugee law
